definitions.definition: To delay movement or action until the arrival or occurrence of; to await. (Now generally superseded by “wait for”.)
To delay movement or action until some event or time; to remain neglected or in readiness.
definitions.example: Wait here until your car arrives.

definitions.definition: To wait tables; to serve customers in a restaurant or other eating establishment.
definitions.example: She used to wait down at the Dew Drop Inn.

definitions.definition: To attend on; to accompany; especially, to attend with ceremony or respect.
To attend as a consequence; to follow upon; to accompany.
To defer or postpone (especially a meal).
To remain chaste while one's lover is unavailable.
The act of staying or remaining in expectation.
